s.text: Some companies have pushed up their debt-equity ratios --raising more money through bonds and less through stocks--and thus changed payments (to investors) that used to be called "dividends" into "interest."
Second: Others claim that the rate of return that the average investor expects to receive on stocks has fallen.
Second: Others claim that the rate of return that the average investor expects to receive on stocks has fallen.
In the past, whenever general stock prices have gotten as high relative to fundamentals as they are today, the next decade has been an extremely bad one in which to invest in the stock market.

The most famous of these predictions came just before the stock-market crash of 1929, when Yale Professor Irving Fisher reassured investors that stock prices had attained a "permanently high plateau."
In the past, demand for stocks was limited by fear of risk . Investors could look to the bond market and see the chance for a decent return with total safety.
In the past, demand for stocks was limited by fear of risk . Investors could look to the bond market and see the chance for a decent return with total safety.
He did not say that he was worried because the stock market was overvalued: He asked how he could figure out whether the stock market was overvalued.
